definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Lao2 gong1 Zu3 zhi1

sentences.english: Labor rights groups have also criticized Disney and Dell.
sentences.chinese: 劳工权利组织也对迪尼斯和戴尔进行了批评。

sentences.english: The seventh day also shall be most solemn and holy unto you: you shall do no servile work therein.
sentences.chinese: 到第七日再召开圣会，一切劳工都不许做。

sentences.english: The other key component is labor-market policy.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个重要的政策使劳工市场政策。

sentences.english: We ony recruit our manpower that has been approved by Local Government Authority.
sentences.chinese: 我们配合当地政府所规定的条例来聘请劳工。

sentences.english: Seattle brought together organised labour and various single-issue campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 西雅图聚集了有组织的劳工和各单项问题的运动。

sentences.english: His organization looks at life for working-class Americans.
sentences.chinese: 他所在的机构关注美国劳工阶层的生活。

sentences.english: But they're often falling into the hands of unscrupulous labor brokers.
sentences.chinese: 但他们往往落入黑心的劳工中介手中。

sentences.english: a laborer assigned to a section gang.
sentences.chinese: 被分配指派到工段养路班的劳工。

sentences.english: Why should the lot of rural workers be so miserable?
sentences.chinese: 为什么有那么多农村劳工的生活如此困窘呢？

sentences.english: The Labour Department administers labour laws in force in the HKSAR.
sentences.chinese: 劳工处负责执行香港特别行政区的劳工法例。

sentences.english: The Labour Department administers labour laws in force in the HKSAR.
sentences.chinese: 劳工处负责执行香港特别行政区的劳工法例。

sentences.english: Most of the voters are lining up to support him in the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 有几年，联合会对劳联表示敬重，以支持劳工运动。

sentences.english: The labour in the harbour can distinguish between forty-four colours.
sentences.chinese: 港口的那个劳工能区分四十四种颜色。

sentences.english: The above records shall be submitted to the Labor Insurance Supervisory Commission.
sentences.chinese: 前项书表，应送劳工保险监理委员会。

sentences.english: In the past Hispanics remained disproportionately poor and working class.
sentences.chinese: 过去，贫穷人口和劳工阶层始终占拉美裔的很大比例。

sentences.english: The money the migrants sent back was a lifeline.
sentences.chinese: 劳工寄回家的都是救命钱。

definition: to press into service/to impress/to commandeer
forced labor/corvée (labor required of a serf)/animal labor
able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
migrant worker/temporary worker enlisted on a public project
